TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ICustomIdentityConfiguration

summary.span: 定义使类加载习惯配置的方法。

span.span: Defines methods that enable a class to load custom configuration.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类实现接口可以从 XML 加载自定义配置。Classes that implement the interface can load custom configuration from XML. 多个 Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) 类实现接口，以提供的功能，可以定义自定义配置的派生类从配置文件。Several of the Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) classes implement the interface to provide the capability for you to define custom configuration of derived classes from a configuration file. 许多 WIF 类提供此方法以提供它们所表示的对象的默认配置的基实现。Many of the WIF classes provide a base implementation of this method to provide the default configuration for the objects they represent.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LoadCustomConfiguration(class System.Xml.XmlNodeList nodeList) cil managed

param.name: nodeList
param.span: 包含自定义配置的 XML 节点。

span.span: The XML nodes that contain the custom configuration.

param.span: 列表中的每个节点都属于 类型。

span.span: Each node in the list is of type .

summary.span: 从 XML 加载自定义的配置。
重写此元素以提供配置元素的自定义处理。

span.span: Override this method to provide custom handling of configuration elements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 配置基础结构调用方法。The method is called by the configuration infrastructure. 调用此方法时，`nodelist`参数包含配置的配置文件中的对象类的父元素的顶级子元素。When this method is called, the `nodelist` parameter contains the top-level child elements of the parent element that configures the object class from the configuration file. 例如，一个类派生自，将具有的子元素[ <issuerNameRegistry> ](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/issuernameregistry.md)元素中传递`nodelist`参数。For example, a class derived from , will have the child elements of the [<issuerNameRegistry>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/issuernameregistry.md) element passed in the `nodelist` parameter. `nodelist`完全组成对象。The `nodelist` is composed entirely of objects. 每个可能属性和子元素，具体取决于正在配置的类定义的配置架构。Each of these may have attributes and child elements depending on the configuration schema defined for the class that is being configured.
